Well, RPG means "Role Playing Game". It's a specific genre that tackles us playing a character in a fictional setting, which can have a wide range of stories to tell. There's also many sub-genres of RPGs too.

VR means "Virtual Reality"; it's like diving into a dream, but the sensations are like real life. MMO means "Massively Multiplayer Online"... basically, a lot of players doing game stuff at the same time.

Well, because GGO - Gun Gale Online - is a game, we don't actually get hurt using guns. It's like... solid dummies do all our actions for us, but we control them and experience everything through them.
Yes, I am somewhat experienced with guns in that game, Lux. But if you put one in my hand right now, I'm not sure I'd be any good with it... unless I was under attack, maybe.

Well Amy, the key is being aggressive in a certain way, but without coming on strong. You gotta invite Sonic out for some activities - without making it seem like a date - and make it worth his time.

...That sounds like my situation pre-SAO. Everything seemed fine until I was in-game, and we were all told that we couldn't log out. It took a little before I got over the terror, but I managed after that...

Playing this game reminds me of fighting on the front lines in SAO. I'm not sure why though... is it just the fighting? I mean, it's a friendly game, but I am against other players.

Regardless of this game's results, I might not write it down in my journal... I don't think I'll need written proof to remember it.
(You know, when this game is over, I wonder if I should play ALO or GGO... hmm, but which game sounds more fun today?)
I just keep thinking about my honeymoon with Kazuto, back in SAO. Maybe it was only in-game, but it was real to us... yet of course, we do want to get married in real life at some point.
Mmh. I keep thinking about those afternoons spent in-game ALO, just sitting together... feeling the wind on our faces. Ah, ALO is just the best place for our family.
(GGO's kinda pretty to look at, in its own way, but I definitely prefer fantasy worlds over reality types when I play games.)
(Mmh, even now I'm picturing me, Kazuto, and Yui in our Floor 22 home. It's not exactly the same as it was in SAO, but it might as well be; it's where we first became a family.)
Even though I'm here right now, I sometimes imagine that I'm playing a VRMMO game... just because they're so much fun for me and my friends.

As far as my dreams, well, I'm not sure yet of what I'd like to do after finishing school. Well, other than to continue to be with Kazuto and Yui, forever. But I've got time to figure that out, and I know they'll support me.
Kazuto works so hard to find a way, any way to have our daughter Yui be with us in the real world. I hope with all my heart that he succeeds too!
I wonder how Kirito's doing right now. I hope he's not getting into trouble again...
Just so you know, if I find out there was cheating in this game, you're gonna deal with the Berserk Healer. AKA, me.
(Mom wouldn't be happy that I'm playing this game. I doubt dad would either, but he has been out of touch with us for a while...)
Hmm, I wonder if my friend Suguha will ever notice Recon's obvious crush on her... probably not, unless someone tells her straight out. (Ironically, they've been friends far longer than I have.)
Part of me's glad my friend Klein doesn't know about this place. I mean, he's a good guy and is harmless, but he can get... tempted sometimes.
I wonder if later, I could find some kind of dragon plushie for my friend, Keiko. It wouldn't be the same as having Pina with her in real life, but I'm sure she'd appreciate it anyway.
(Hmm, I've been playing GGO for a while, but I've never actually tried for a gun build in that game... maybe I could try it on another account later.)
(T-This is so embarrassing, and yet... it's kind of thrilling...)
(I-I'm still feeling a lot... but my body's actually starting to ease into this situation.)
(I-I think my body likes this somewhat... well, uh, I'll just have to use that too.)
(I'm becoming more and more. relaxed in this... situation. S-Slowly, but still.)
(I... I think I'm becoming better at this already...)
(W-Well... as much as this game won't be a regular thing I do, I'm not quite as embarrassed as before. T-That's good.)
(Maybe it's because I've been like this for a little, but maybe I was... a little too against showing some skin.)
(D-Deep down, I guess I was a little too worried about my modesty...)
Even now I still think about Sword Art Online, the first VRMMO game of its kind. A beautiful world with a floating castle, great RPG mechanics... and my literal home for two years.
In a way, each hand is almost like clearing a Floor: you have to face a boss at the end of the level - in this case, other players - just to advance.
Does this place have a no-touching rule...? I think I saw something mentioned about that. (I remember that SAO had the same thing; you couldn't do inappropriate things without getting penalized.)
In most games, PvP is just heated battles, and that applies here with the 'betting'. In SAO... people who did that were knowingly committing murder.
SAO was a complete virtual experience: you could taste food, feel the wind, and a lot more. You could even feel tired and hungry in-game, because it recreated your senses that way.

SAO could render a lot of realistic details, to really sell the immersion of it's world being real, even if it was still a game. Though it only rendered what you're looking at, for performance reasons.
Some games have level progression, others are skill-based... yet others manage to do both, which affects a whole bunch of game aspects, including PvP.
Flying in ALO was always a great sensation, even when it was limited, or so I heard. I only started playing after unlimited flight was granted to everyone in-game.
(I remember Yui telling me that Kirito had trouble flying in ALO at first... the game's flight mechanics were pretty different. As his girlfriend, I wish I could've seen that.)

(Unlike SAO, which was "meant" to be lived in, ALO's moral codes are difficult to turn off. That's probably for the best, but at the same time it's... u-uh, well uh... hard for me and Kazuto to do anything there.)
Even though death in-game isn't usually a big deal, it's still a little hard for me sometimes, thanks to my... experience.
ALO does have nine fairy races in-game, but there was a reward in a Grand Quest for a tenth... or so we were told; it was a complete, utter lie.
Unlike most VRMMO games, Gun Gale Online is well, all about guns and such hehe. It's also a lot more sci-fi than fantasy, but I guess that's part of its appeal.
One thing I appreciate about GGO, as a gamer, is that you have to know what path your game character will take beforehand; there's no easy resets.

Despite mostly being about guns, there are a few sword-like weapons in the virtual game GGO. My boyfriend and I use them to deflect bullets... it kinda makes us famous, because no one else can figure out how.

Most of my friends and I got into GGO, another virtual game, rather late... my boyfriend didn't, because he dove head-first into a dangerous situation, again. I get that's who Kirito is, but he really worried us!
(Without GGO's bullet-assist system, I'm not sure Kazuto and I would be able to deflect bullets in-game. After all, we kinda just predict the predictive paths... or that's how my boyfriend puts it.)
Watching the Bullet of Bullet game tournament in GGO was fun, even with what went on behind-the-scenes. I just hope me and my friends might try the next one, whenever that is.
Since Ordinal Scale is an augmented game, only the players perceive any changes. To passersby though, we might look rather silly, moving around and attacking invisible things.
Unlike virtual reality, where you're basically sleeping, augmented reality happens while you're wide awake. It's a great way to have fun and exercise.
(It's a shame Kazuto isn't into the Ordinal Scale game more. I worry about him not getting enough exercise, and sometimes he even forgets to eat while working...)
Rather than levels, we have rankings in the Ordinal Scale game; the higher, the better of course. But of course skill is still very important.
I do hope Ordinal Scale has more appearances of former SAO boss monsters in the future. Even if the first event for that game nearly ended... badly, playing against familiar creatures was pretty fun!
Although I do miss having Sword Skills, it's nice that in OS, you can practice anywhere on your own time. You don't have to throw yourself into battle.
W-Wait... if I'm going to get better, I- I can't just settle for people seeing my front...
Eh, nani!? ...Just kidding hehe. It happens.
What fun would it be if I didn't lose too?
Course I had to lose. Who gets off when you've still got clothes on?
Wow, everyone wants to see my body. Can't say I blame you!
Looks like I'll be joining the ranks of the sexy bodies here!
The moment you've all been waiting for. I'll make you all hard, or wet. Maybe both, if you're into that.
It's off... thank god I remembered! Now then, back to- uh? Wait, I lost?
*Sigh* That could've been really bad... oh, my cards. (Is my hand really the lowest?)
I can only imagine Yui's questions if she'd seen... anything more than this. But anyway, my daughter can't... oh? Drat, I lost.

condition.saying: Having a blonde moment, ~name~? I do that all the time.

The fact that you're saying that, other me, proves who really fits that stereotype right now...

condition.saying: Need some tips on playing, ~name~?

case.state: (This attitude can't have been how I sounded like... or at least, I wasn't this bad!)
Keep those to yourself, other me. I'm a gamer; I'll work it out.
Stiff? Oh, I guess that's fair, Fate. I'm not exactly comfortable with s-sexual situations like this... yet I do want to try and change that, as much as I can. That's why I'm here.
Well, it's because I'm not... experienced with this kind of situation, Fate. Even so, I'm here because I... I'm trying to improve that. I'm not sure how I'll do, exactly, but I need to at least try.
Actually, Nami, the VR bit is an acronym for the type of game it is, not the game's actual name. In this case, it means 'Virtual Reality', like experiencing a vivid dream.
That's not the game's name, Nami; merely it's type of game. It stands for 'Virtual Reality', as if you're experiencing another world in a dream, which is pretty cool!
Well, unless it's a formal event or something, I actually don't mind not being referred to by honorifics, ~gwen~.
If you insist, you can use -san, ~gwen~. Although I won't mind if you don't use it either, just for the record.
Well actually, Meia, our bodies are asleep while our minds experience VR... though AR is pretty much the same as a regular simulation, now that I think about it.
I suppose they do, Meia. Sure, some people think that VR and AR are just games, but they're also real enough that you're "living" in those worlds while playing. Or I like to think so, at least.

condition.saying: You've got a real hard-on

case.state: Hmph, well you're a right ray of sunshine, Revy. Do you always insult everyone you meet?
(Well I never!)Oh, "hard-on". Hilarious, Revy.

condition.saying: Does your beloved boyfriend

case.state: That is none of your business, Revy. I'm here so that I can try to improve myself, mainly for my own sake.
Spreading my- as if! Why was that the first assumption you jumped to, Revy!?
Not exactly, Fina. I've played regular poker a few times, so I've got a good idea how to play, but I'm not expert at every game out there.
I'd like to say that I am, Fina, but I'd be lying. The games me and my friends play are usually a lot more 'involved' than a simple card game.
You said you're a gambler, Fate. That explains why you're here, checking the place out, but are you okay with there not being any reward?
I get you being a gambler, Fate, but uh... unless I missed it, there's no reward for this game. Is that okay with you?
Actually, Leonie, I taught myself how to use my rapier. Although it is a sword, it needs a different type of training than the normal ones.
I'm self-taught, Leonie. I and everyone else I knew had to learn by ourselves, though we could practice with each other at least.
Oh, there's definitely a way, Fina, as my world sells machines that create these game worlds. They're a little pricey, but I can easily get you one, and be there when you try it out if you'd like.
No problem there, Fina. I can easily get you the machines that do so, and bring my own so that you won't be alone, whenever you decide to dive in.
Ah... um well, technically, I guess? I mean, I am a mom to Yui, but I'm not even twenty yet, Saki.
...Technically, maybe? But aren't they usually adults? I'm still only eighteen, even though I am a mom to Yui.
Huh? An autobiography? ...I hadn't considered that at all, honestly. But uh, I don't have much experience with writing either.
Well uh yes, I am a little young to be a mother, Miss Grunt. I never planned on it happening the way that it did... but even so, I wouldn't change a thing.
Maybe I am too young by normal standards, Miss Grunt. But even so, me and my boyfriend love Yui, and she loves us; we want to stay together, so we do.
Ahh... not precisely, Saki. I'm not used to lewd situations, exactly, and I'm here hoping to change that.
Actually, I'm not really used to this, Saki. The lewd, sexual stuff, I mean... so I'm hoping that something like this might get used to it.
That's right, Yuri. I mostly play virtual reality games, which have us dreaming as we explore a fictional world. There we fight monsters, help each other, and all that kind of stuff.

Yes, I do. Mostly I play the RPG type- oh, sorry, role playing game. Basically you play through a story, fighting enemies the whole time, and sometimes even team up with others to tackle difficult content.
More than I ever expected I'd have, Petra, for sure. But that's mostly against game monsters, who always behave in predictable ways... eheh.
Yeah. At first, it was only in games, but I was fighting for my actual life too. And now my skills there carry over to real life... well, sorta.
Well yeah, I'd say so, Kumatora. Though I only react with toughness when something's wrong, mostly.
I'd say so, though I prefer to be nice all the time. By the sound of it, you're the same, Kumatora... ah, the 'being tough' part, I mean.
Well, my experience with virtual reality is mostly entertainment, Samus... you know, like a game. Well, for the most part anyway.

Some might use it for other purposes, but for me and my friends, virtual reality is mostly a kind of game. You know, where you dive into a fantasy world, and go on adventures you can't in the normal world.
Well uh, it doesn't sound like a bad idea, Rosa? Thing is, I don't know what Pokemon are... and I'm not sure my mom would accept such a career for myself.
Teaching kids how to fight, and taking care of them? Wow, um... I never thought about that much. Though, me and my boyfriend Kazuto are still learning how to be parents, ehehe...
Yeah I am, Yuri. I actually met him while we were both playing a virtual game, though it took some time before we hung out, let alone started dating.
As surprising as it may sound, I met him while we were both playing a virtual game. It was only after two years that we started dating though... and uh, after a bunch of things happened.
Well, you essentially "dive into" the virtual world that's projected into your brain, which happens while you're unconscious. But it all feels very real, and you remember everything that happens.

Even though you're unconscious in real life, all the sensations of VR - smell, taste, touch, and more - are simulated right into your brain while playing. It feels just as real as reality... and I believe it is real, in a way.
I... I don't see why that would change anything about me, Jessie. If anything, I've faced far worse, and came out on top. Though I'm still only 18, and figuring out some things...

W-Well um, that's probably because I've faced worse things, Jessie. Compared to those, it's difficult for certain things to change you, unless you let them. Though I'm still figuring things out, I see being a mother as a gift...
Speaking of others' opinions, Yuri, what about your Literature Club? I mean, what do the others normally think of your work?
Oh yeah. Yuri, the other people in your club must share opinions about your work, and vice-versa. What's it normally like?
Um, actually... playing games is how me and my boyfriend spend time with Yui, Jessie. She's an AI, who happens to look and behave like a little girl.
Well, aside from talking through our phones, we spend time with our daughter while playing VR games, Jessie. It's where she lives as an AI... though hopefully one day, that'll change.

Oh, well yes, Kyou, you can. It's very advanced technology that sends signals straight to your brain, so you do experience what happens. Though, there is a difference between doing so at home, or on the go...
That's right, Kyou. This technology sends the signals to your brain, so that you experience them for real, unlike typical games. Though there are different versions of how to experience it too...
Jessie, it's not because of the- the "physical" side of things at all! I-I'm not used to situations like this... so I'm playing this game to get some mental experience, and let that sink in first.
H-How can you just say that so easily...? Ah, anyway, I-I'm not here today for "that", Jessie. Just um... so I can make myself braver, mentally. That's all, really...
Er, well, mostly they've been fine, Samus. But the exceptions... are a different story.
For the most part, they've been fine... but even now, the exceptions still weigh on me.
Ah, a commercial? I... don't think I have, at least not for anything really important.
Huh? Um... no, I don't think so? I'm uh, not really that well-known in the real world.
Thanks for the compliment, Hilda. And yeah, I do use a rapier, though it's definitely a different style from regular swords.
You could say that. It took some practice, and you wouldn't believe how much a shield gets in the way of wielding a rapier...
Oh, thank you for saying that, Mari. I have had to learn quickly, since there is a little girl in my life now.
I have an older brother, yet we're not particularly close. But I do have a daughter now... which is probably why I seem that way to you.
Ehehe, technically we're not married yet, Mari. I mean, we consider ourselves married already, especially in the games we play... but we're not there yet in reality.

Well, this ring was a gift from Kazuto. Yet it's not actually that kind of ring... we have yet to get to married in real life, though we feel that we already are. But I'm eagerly awaiting that day, Mari.
Of course I do, but it's mostly just school stuff for now. Otherwise, me and my friends play VR - or AR - to hang out.
Hehe, yeah, but only school work. Me and Kazuto have yet to transtition into, well um... more adult responsibilities, outside of taking care of Yui.
Oh, this thing? It's kind of a game uniform... one that I normally only wear when the game is live, but it appears here without issue.
Oh no, this isn't a work uniform, Mari. It's an outfit I wear whenever a live event happens in a game called Ordinal Scale... which sort of takes place in real life.
Umm... well, there's definitely people who felt that way, Kumatora. But even if they were hard, they were some of the most important times of my life. I wouldn't want to forget them ever again...
...Maybe that's the normal reaction, but honestly, those experiences made me who I am today. It's not something I want to forget... not ever again.
Well, Noire, I don't back down from challenges. But I do wonder if by that, you mean you're playing a god-mode character? I've done that once myself.
A goddess... hehe, guess I'm facing a challenge today! But maybe you're just playing a god-mode character with goddess-like abilities; I've had some experience with that.
Ehehe... well, it's good to know that goddesses are subject to the whims of luck. But one win or loss due to that won't change your skills.
Even if I did win that easily, it'd just be the result of luck, Noire. But one lopsided game doesn't equate to poker skill.
I'm pretty into MMORPGs myself, the VR and AR versions. That is, virtual reality and augmented reality game worlds.

Well, I typically only play two similar genres - both MMORPGs - but how you play each is pretty different in experience. One's in your head while you dream, the other is layered over reality itself, almost like living out a movie.

Well, Kazuto tends to put on a cool front, and he's teasing to a fault... almost annoyingly so, at times. But otherwise, he's earnest, loyal, and despises wrongdoing; in those respects, we just click.
What it feels like to be together? Well, whether we're happy together or annoying each other... we always have each other's backs, and we just feel comfortable around each other.
Oh, well uh... that might not happen for awhile, Mari. I haven't yet told him that I'm coming here for my own reasons, t-though I plan to soon.
This place would be a rather dramatic double date, but um... I-I guess I can mention that to him, after I bring up my reasons for coming here.
I- I haven't yet, no. I wanted to get braver myself first, and have yet to tell him about this place, though I plan to soon. So I haven't thought that far ahead...
I-If you're saying what I think you're saying, Mari... I- I haven't really thought about that before. I mean, our hearts belong to each other, but doing s-such things?
It's called an Augma for short, Hilda. It's a device that helps me in everyday life, and my hobbies as well.
Oh that? Well, Hilda, my Augma isn't jewelry; it's more of a machine. Or a tool, you could also say.
That's quite the compliment... thanks, Mari. Though I feel like I still have some goals to reach, as I wish to be even stronger.
Well, thank you, Mari. I'm not sure that I'm as strong as I can be yet, but hearing you say that does make me feel better. I'll get there eventually, after all.
Y-You're gonna make me blush even harder, Mari. I'm not sure I'll be able to fully do it yet... but I'll still try my best!
That's certainly true from a gaming perspective, though it takes some time to apply such lesson to real life. E-Even so, I'll try and keep it up.

Ehehe, well, some people might not think it's good. I'm not one of them though, because even adults can be dramatic and think they're special. As long as it's not annoying anyone or goes overboard, of course...

Well, um... people have different opinions about whether it's good or bad, though I think it's the former. But it's meant to describe people who talk and gesture dramatically, and brag about having special powers.
Well, I usually adventure with my closest friends, though sometimes we mix it up a little too. We try to have a balance of offense and defense, though I do admit our magical power is a bit limited.
Mostly we're front-line fighters, Darkness. We take turns hitting monsters, distracting them so others can get behind them, or use surprise aerial tactics to get the advantage.
Nobility? Hehe, thank you, but I wouldn't say this uniform is anything like that. (Though I am from a rich family, but I'm pretty sure that's not the same thing.)
Oh, no, it's not like that, Darkness. It's simply a good outfit that gives me the right amount of speed and flexibility; I need that for my attacks.
I appreciate that, but actually, I was thinking the same about you. You seem like you've seen some harder times yourself.
Hehe, thank you, Dunban. Then again, I think many people who go through some hard times come out wiser.
You're correct, Dunban. I didn't expect to become a mother so soon... but after me and my boyfriend found Yui alone, it just felt right after awhile.
It was unexpected for me too... but honestly, Yui became attached to us pretty quickly, and we did too. And now she's become our pride and joy, Dunban.
Huh? Oh, well, yes. Sorry, I didn't realize you saw us back there.
Oh, you saw that? Well um... yeah, he was, Cheryl.
Okay. And...?
I know it must seem quite strange, but...
Ehehe... um, I'm trying to do so for myself first, but I wouldn't mind if it helped when I'm with him too!
Well, uh... a bit of both, I guess? Though I'm starting with just myself first.
Well, I've tried a few different genres, but mainly I like MMORPGs. They've become a big part of my life, in fact.
I'm still relatively new as a gamer girl, yet I've definitely gotten into several MMORPGs. As have a number of my friends, who I met there first.
My Augma? Ehehe... actually, it's just a device people can buy in my world. It doesn't mean I belong to anything.
Oh, this? Well, Binah, my Augma isn't actually anything special like what you said. In fact, if you have the money, anyone can get it.
Huh? Wait, other people? Are- Are you talking about, like-?
I- I don't think I have, and neither has he... but um, why?
Oh, I... w-well, we still don't have much experience, Cheryl. So I kinda only imagine more of- of the normal stuff.
Err... I guess that, well, simply more normal stuff. It's not like we've been doing it for too long. (And also, we've yet to do it in the real world, but that'd only confuse Cheryl...)
W-What!? Kiss!? I... I...
Ah!? T-That's a really sudden thing to mention...
Sure. As long as you're actually okay with my boyfriend seeing you in that state, eheh.
Oh yeah, if you're up for it! Though if you just want it to stay between us, that's fine too.
Eheh, well thank you; you're not too bad yourself. I'm still not used to these kinds of compliments, but talking with you is helping me there a little.
Oh, well... I'm flattered, Cheryl. And I'm glad you feel that way, as I feel the same, despite us having just met earlier.
Ehehe, actually Nami, Yui's my adopted daughter. Though I totally understand why you would've thought that.
Oh no, it's not like that, Nami. I didn't give birth to Yui, because I and Kazuto adopted her.

It started with us hanging out and adventuring for awhile, but though we got along well, eventually I realized that Kazuto was used to being a loner. So I had to start taking matters into my own hands, if I wanted to get anywhere.

Hehe, well Nami, I did have to get slightly aggressive after awhile. I mean, we got along well and hung out a lot... but Kazuto was too 'comfortable' being the loner type, so I felt like I'd be waiting awhile if I left it up to him.
In most games I play, luck is usally a background element rather than the main focus like it is here. So, I'd say maybe a little well, Yumeko.
Well, only a little, Yumeko. I mean, luck is a factor in many games, but usually for smaller things like critical hits, but I haven't played many games where luck is the main draw.
Hmm? Oh, I guess you could say that, Aqua. Though it's more of a hobby than anything.
Kind of, I guess. Me and my friends do explore adventuring worlds a bunch, when we have the time to do so together.
Oh, sure. The games I play are mostly virtual or augmented reality types. Like, instead of just pressing buttons, you're physically part of the world... though in different senses between the two.

I'm mostly into the MMO types of games, where I can experience playing alongside my friends. But we take it up another notch, because we physically move in those games, as part of a virtual or augmented simulation.

That's easy to say, until you're trapped in such a game, where dying in-game means you die in real life... I'm glad to be free of that danger, but don't you dare say I don't know what it's like, Aqua.

Oh, I know full well what it's like to be in danger, Aqua. The first VR game I played trapped ten thousand people inside... if you died there, you died in real life. Compared to that, I'll take regular game danger any day.
Not really, Aqua. They're more of an extension of the real world; we laugh there, cry, among other things as we do outside the game. It means a lot to me, and all those I care about.

Hardly. If anything, I view my time there as not that different from the real world. It's where I met all my friends and my boyfriend - even now, it's another way for us to spend time together, to enjoy ourselves.

Hmm, I'm not entirely sure how "serious" you can get. Whether it's monsters or PvP duels, the only real risk is losing all your HP... which means you lose some character progression upon respawning. But you're probably looking for more, right?

Well, besides monsters, players can engage in duels, though most set it to stop past certain HP numbers. But even if you "died" and lost some progress, you still respawn like normal... which I'm guessing isn't what you're looking for, right?
What I like to do? Well, beyond hanging out with my friends, I do a tiny bit of sewing on the side, but mostly I love cooking. Most people can never get enough of anything I make!
Hmm, I do occasionally sew, but that's mainly as a distraction rather than a serious hobby. More than anything, I like to cook; I have a real knack for it, if I do say so myself.
It was only a game to him; an excuse for murder. And he inflicted this "punishment" upon others without their consent, knowing full well that his victims didn't know the stakes.
He "created" those stakes, sure... but it wasn't by the players' choice; they didn't know they were actually at risk of death. It was simply an excuse to "play the game", to kill people.
Wha-!? I... I-I just had a few small things left, but now I...
(W-Why did I lose so much all of a sudden? Now I have to reveal my...)

I-I was in such a safe spot only a few turns ago, but now I'm gonna be s-standing around in my underwear...
T-This is unbelievable! Did someone rig my cards!?
(W-Why is this happening? I just lost my gloves not too long ago... and now I'll be half-naked...)
Mmh... i-it was one thing to have to show off my bra before, but this string of luck is insulting!
(N-Not just showing my bra, but having to take it off so soon!? What's wrong with my luck?)
I... I-I was going to do my best no matter what, but did I have to lose three times in a row!?
H-How did I go from showing my underwear to having to becoming nude so fast!?
(I-I just wanted a normal game, not to lose many times in a row! Mmh...)
I-It's like I'm being punished for no good reason!
Three losses in a row!? Of all the...!
I know luck is a factor in poker, but this is unfair...
This is-!? ...Mmm no, I can't let it get to me. I've just gotta make up for it with a great winning streak!
Two losses in a row... well, at least it happened while I still have this many clothes on.
I'm not keen on this string of bad luck, but better now than later.
*Sigh* Two in a row; that's just great. (I'll need to be more careful, as I don't want this streak to continue.)
W-Why did I have to lose twice in a row now?
I just lost last round, a-and now I have to...
I-I was hoping I'd be able to put this off a little longer...
O-Oh come on! I just showed everyone my bra, and now I...
(A-And now I'll just be in my default gear...)
Couldn't there at least have been one more round before this happened!? Mmh...
I-I can't even keep my bra on for a bit longer!?
(I-I thought I'd at least have a little time to be like this, b-before I...)
I didn't want to show my breasts this quickly... I'd hoped to have a little more time to prepare myself...
But I-! Mmh, h-how did I go from being in my underwear to having to get naked in no time flat!?
(T-This is the worst kind of luck, I swear!)
Immediately after showing my chest, I-I have to show my..,
Damn it...
For the love of...! Gah.
*Sigh* I guess I'm not terribly surprised...
Mmm... I knew my hand was weak, but I can't believe you beat me with a better High Card.
(Even though it wasn't much of a chance, I was kinda hoping that still might actually work...)
I lost with a pair? Mmh... well, I suppose this isn't an uncommon thing to happen.
(Mmh. Well, this decent hand just lost to a more decent one.)
Oh well. My hand was a good chance, but by no means a great one.

Well I'm not exactly in a bad spot. I guess it'll be fine.
(Got plenty of defenses left for now. I'll be fine.)
Oh well; guess any kind of perfect victory was unlikely.
Well, that took awhile. It's giving me plenty of time to prepare as well.
Well, I'm still in a good spot, but I have to keep improving no matter what.
(Alright. After this, I'm gonna do even better at the game, so that I can maintain the lead as much as possible.)
...Mmh. I know I lost, but I wish I could keep the lead as high as possible.
I gotta start working even harder. I'm in a good spot, but if I don't stay serious, that could change faster than I'd like.
As much as I would like a decisive win, I respect that you're making it as close as possible.
I was hoping I'd won before this point, b-but I guess that's just luck for you...
Y-You're all making this a close game... so, good on you for that.
(Everyone else is already showing skin, s-so this will be easier. Just keep that in mind, Asuna.)
...You're really trying to get me even with everyone. G-Getting me down to my default gear.
I-I'm so close to winning, yet you guys are making me pay for every victory...
But I'm ahead... s-so why is luck deciding on me having to join everyone?

I-I was hoping I'd shown enough already...
I'm supposed to be ahead, b-but it's starting to feel like I'm not anywhere close anymore...
Eheh, w-wow. This is a really close game, even to the end...
Even though it's just small things, every loss counts for a gamer.
I guess I have to play more; knowing when to trade cards, and when not to, is a bit more complicated than it looks.
Well, that's unfortunate. But I'm nowhere near out yet, so I'll just get even better.
If this were any other kind of game, I would've been fine with my little Yui showing up partway through. (Though, maybe her help would've been considered cheating.)
(I wonder if using my phone between rounds would be considered cheating, even if I was just passing the time...) Hmm? Oh, I lost?
Maybe next time, we can chat and get to know each other over dinner or something instead.
I know everyone would be cheering me on, even for something like this. I'll use that.
Well, I'm not surprised to have gotten to this point. It's rare for games of luck to go with few losses.
Much more of this, and I'll be in real "trouble"... (but um, I'll handle whatever happens. That's why I'm here, after all.)
You're all playing to win too, I see. Well, of course you were, but you know what I mean.
A- Alright. Just uh, g-give me a second...
O-Oh... so I'm up now. (T-This will be embarrassing, but I can handle it!)

(I-I wish I could reload a save point, like some of the games that I play.)
Mmh, t-this is going to be a close game, for sure...

I-I'll do it, but... please don't stare at me...
I- I never thought I'd have to show off my underwear this early...

Now I'll have to... um, c-can you please look away?

Well, we typically dive into games. There's many different kinds, each with different ways of playing, but me and my friends play MMOs. That is, worlds where many players play at once in real time, instead of a world focused around just you.

The most common types of games are MMOs, Samus. Basically, instead of a world focused around your adventures, many people are adventuring at the same time - sometimes we help each other, or fight, but it's fairly open as how you can play.
Oh, good. Though uh, I didn't experience an early pregancy, Jessie. Me and my boyfriend found Yui as a little girl, and it wasn't long before we adopted her together.

Well, the Augma is a recent invention in my world, Lux. How it works is complicated, but I can do a lot with it: I can play small games on it to pass the time, or send messages to my friends, among other things.
Oh, you have a friend who uses a rapier too, Lux? I'd like to meet her one day. Maybe even have a friendly duel.

I prefer using a rapier, but photon swords are pretty cool too. They're made of hard light, making them incredibly hot to the touch, so they can slice through most anything. You gotta be careful with them though.

If that place uses only those colors, Lux, maybe I would've stood out too much there...

Well, Yui's quite smart for her age, and is hardly one for rebellion. Though Kazuto likes to joke that she will be once she grows up more...
